div.address: Tweede Jan Steenstraat, 3 , Amsterdam 1073 VK , The Netherlands (Stadsdeel Zuid)

span.class: srtLnk taLnk sort_1 hvrIE6 sprite-sortArrowDnBl sortArrow

div.p: In my opinion really no other restaurant in Amsterdam beats this small, cosy one in The Pijp. The food is amazing, it is culinary but not to the point that it is more of a science project than something you enjoy eating. It is just perfect. The guy that does the wine section is really enthusiastic; he sorts out wines... More
Very friendly service. Good suite of small to medium plates. Mostly sea products. Good wine. Good dessert.

As a seasoned traveler and sybarite, which my age supports, I was astounded that LE Restaurant, Amsterdam, did not have Michelin Stars. It is comparable to Sa√ºc in Barcelona or Agli Tre Amici in Udine, Italy. Superb ensemble of selections very assembled by a professional and affectionate team. The wine list was adequate, but needs to be expanded a bit... More

div.span: See 3 more reviews by JoseAntonio1945 for Amsterdam

div.p: I ve made a reservation a few weeks earlier for I knew it is not possible to get a table in this restaurant any other way. My husband and I were celebrating our 20iest year together so for starters I think we had the best table. A large 2 persons table overlooking the restaurant and with a nice view of... More

div.span: See 9 more reviews by doubleyoudee for Amsterdam

div.p: All superlatives used by previous customers are completely justified. There is one menu with small modifications (don't do it) if you insist. The amuses are very refined, predicting a marvellous diner. I'm living 40 years in Amsterdam and I can assure you: this is one of the best culinary experiences of our city. I try to go at Le Restaurant... More

div.span: See 4 more reviews by janalexis for Amsterdam

div.p: Le Restaurant is a top class restaurant , with a friendly , intimate style that is always full of fun. Set in the ground floor front rooms of a house in De Pip & so away from the central tourist area, it has only 24 covers or so . The menu offers a seemingly endless array of amuses, fish, meat... More

div.span: See 3 more reviews by georgemba for Amsterdam

div.p: It becomes a bit dull to write a review that so closely echoes all the others but - if nothing other than to keep the numbers up - I have to carry on regardless. Great place. Great food..really Michelin quality. Set menu so just sit back and enjoy. Geweldig!

div.span: See 6 more reviews by Poorty for Amsterdam

div.p: There is not much more to say really ... - this place is amazingly good ... "only" has 1 Michelin * ... - which is so not fair .... but maybe the owner is actually more content ... as the clientele is maybe more down to earth as well .... There is a set menu so not spoilt for choices... More

div.span: See 3 more reviews by TT-CB for Amsterdam

div.p: cannot agree more with last reviewer, (tigerwoods100) this is the absolute top in quality, in quality/price, in ambiance etc etc enough said and yes every real food lover/connoisseur has to go there! i am looking forward to go again.

We did not expect less, but this is one of the best restaurants in The Netherlands. Why? because they combine the best food and wine with a good sense of humor, relaxed attitude at a reasonable price for what you get. It is not your typical Michelin star approach and that is one of the reasons it is appealing. It... More
